items.name: Chicken Tikka
items.description: Spicy, juicy and filled with flavours, these mouth watering chikka tikkas are evryone's favourite since days and continue to be one!!

items.name: Vada Pao
items.description: Vada Pao have been really famous for their uniqueness also for their amazing taste as well, they come with a deep fried vada packed in between two paos!

items.name: Seekh Kebab
items.description: It's preparation takes some time but the end result is rather good, they pack the taste of all the spices with green chillies and garlic all combined in a beautiful manner.

items.name: Honey Chilli Potato
items.description: This is not just a regular potato that we buy in bulk from a supermarket, and our adjective totally justifies our price. So, it is authentic, and our legal team thinks this is probably going to land us in hot water.

items.name: Chicken Fried Rice
items.description: If you like eating Fried Rice out of things that could easily be served any time of day, then we have the perfect thing for you. Comes with great flavours depending on how northern you sound.

items.name: Hot Fries
items.description: This is literally just fries john, where did you get this picture? Our fries looks nothing like this. No fries does – who the heck has the time to make fries like this? [NOTE FOR john: Replace this with actual marketing text]

items.name: Butter Chicken
items.description: What's better than a creamy chicken gravy with lots of butter that has been hand-made by our chefs? obviously nothing!

items.name: Mushroom Tagliatelle
items.description: If you're the kind of  guy who likes salami-filled Italian food with a twist, this is the perfect dish for you. The twist? We lied about the meat.

items.name: Big Bang Burger
items.description: It's a truth universally acknowledged that every restaurant is in want of a burger, and trust us: this thing is so big you can't even get your mouth around it without dislocating your jaw.

items.name: Mutton Curry
items.description: This dish errs more towards "scorching" than "spicy", so let us know ahead of time if you want it so we can put a few fire engines on standby.

items.name: Paella Alicante
items.description: This is paella made Alicante-style. We don't quite know what that means, but we need to justify the Spanish junket somehow. ¡Olé!

items.name: Tomato Pizza
items.description: Many people believe that pizza, can detox their body, and if that's you we're happy to take your money from you with this one.

items.name: Pesto Farfalle
items.description: Cheap, filling, and green enough to make you tell yourself that it's healthy, our pesto farfalle is made from 100% recycled bow ties.

items.name: Long Sub
items.description: Seriously? You want us to measure it and write down the actual length? Listen, I know we're a hip cafe, but anyone rich enough to afford this price probably doesn't want to know.

items.name: Tofu Fried Rice
items.description: It's again fried Rice. It's not aged, it's not rubbed in kosher salt, it's not  or some other gibberish – it's just some pieces of tofu with rice on a plate. Might come with sauce if you ask nicely.

items.name: Chilli Chicken
items.description: It's just some pieces of chicken; not that complicated, really. Oh, and soy sauce, obviously. Wait… and chilli sauce it seems? I can't really tell – I'm squinting at the picture and it looks like it's peppers. Maybe onions too? Honestly, your guess is as good as mine.

items.name: Pepperoni Pizza
items.description: Our chef spent years trying out various authentic Neapolitan recipes for pizza, but in the end we found this really good frozen thing from Waitrose and we can't tell the difference. If you buy this you'll be in an A/B test where you'll get one of the two served to you.

items.name: Eggs And Steaks
items.description: This is literally our full course meal except we picked off the bits of salami and ran it under a cold tap for a couple of seconds.

items.name: Gulab Jamun
items.description: People keep asking us why this thing has D and V for its restrictions, and it's making other customers worry that we are some sort of D&V hotspot.

items.name: Choco Brownies
items.description: For times when one, two, or even three brownies aren't enough, we're proud to present choco brownies – four brownies, to fully satisfy your craving for these sweet delights!

items.name: Marshmellow With Chocolate
items.description: Marshmellows! More marshmellows! And yet more of them! Exactly how many you get depends on the day – we pretty much cram them all on to a plate then see how many we can balance as we walk them to your table.

items.name: Sweet Balls
items.description: This is no regular sweet – it's a super sweet! I think that means it wears glasses and has an unusual fear of kryptonite? Yeah, that sounds about right.

items.name: Virgin Mojito
items.description: The mojito is a classic drink of rum, mint, lime, and soda, but without the rum. So, this is basically an expensive glass of Sprite. We might put an umbrella in it so you don't feel quite so scammed.

items.name: Strawberry Cooler
items.description: Step 1: Blend some frozen strawberries. Step 3: Profit! If you're reading this it means you've figured out step 2 for yourself.

items.name: Mango Smoothie
items.description: In the same way that brandy is distilled wine, in this mango is distilled in milk. Yes, we literally blend it again and again to remove as much water as possible, leaving some thick stuff that is pretty much guaranteed to make your eyes pop.

items.name: Watermelon Smoothie
items.description: What do you get if you mix watermelon with some more stuff? I mean, the answer is pretty much in the name – we really ought to get a better marketing team.

items.name: Avocado Smoothie
items.description: This is a smoothie made from Avocado. No, we're not quite sure how that works either. Do we press the leaves?  It sounds wild. Maybe we milked it to make this drink.

items.name: Oreo Shake
items.description: What do you get if you pour a whole bottle of milk into a glass with some oreo biscuits? This – you get this. Fun fact: oranges aren't named that because they are colored orange, but because they are high in the vitamin orangoflavin. (Note: not actually true.)
